intro: Habranthus bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia starflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts are underway to protect its natural habitat.
